column2: INDIANA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column8: hill

column2: 2. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 3. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 4. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column8: the law.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 5. This signal means:
column8: Stop

column2: 6. After being pulled over by law enforcement, a driver should immediately exit the vehicle and approach the officer’s squad car.
7. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 8. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: a divided highway is ahead.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 9. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column8: Long-distance commuters.

column2: 10. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column8: Shift workers.

column2: 11. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.
column8: on hills.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column8: Double curve ahead

column2: 13. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: come to a complete stop.
column10: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 14. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.
column8: low clearance.

column2: 15. If you are turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you may also turn left on a red signal after stopping, if traffic is clear and there is not a NO TURN ON RED sign.
16. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 17. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 18. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 19. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 20. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column8: If traffic conditions require it.
column10: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 21. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: yellow warning lights.

column2: 22. When approaching an oncoming vehicle, drivers are required to dim their high beams within:
column8: 100 feet

column2: 23. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 24. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 25. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 26. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 27. When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates) a driver should look, listen and slow down.
28. In a situation with a flat tire or blowout, the driver should apply the brakes quickly and pull off the road immediately to check the tire.
29. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column8: indicate HOV lanes.
column10: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 30. When approaching a blind person walking with a white cane or guide dog, drivers should yield the right-of-way.
31. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
32. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column8: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 33. Never make a U-turn from:
column8: the lane you’re in.
column10: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 34. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column10: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 35. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column8: Farm machinery

column2: 37. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column6: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column8: speed up and proceed through the intersection.

column2: 38. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column10: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 39. To regain their license, drivers whose license has been revoked as a result of DUI must meet several requirements, including an evaluation for alcohol and drug problems and paying a reinstatement fee.
40. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 41. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 42. A yellow arrow means:
column4: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 43. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 44. At night, if an oncoming vehicle fails to dim its high beams, you should look toward the right edge of the road.
45. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 46. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column8: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 47. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column8: After the crosswalk.

column2: 48. Drivers are required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
49. Your driving privileges will be suspended if you are convicted of illegally passing a stopped school bus.
50. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
